learning_outcomes.description: Identify and evaluate common chronic health conditions and their management in a variety of care settings.
Apply and evaluate a population health approach to understanding chronic conditions to facilitate health promotion and prevention principles when assessing individuals.
Critically analyse and apply evidence-based approaches to supporting individuals with a chronic health issue and their significant others.

Critically analyse and evaluate differences between models of care in acute and non-acute healthcare environments to explore and evaluate the role of person-centred care in the context of chronic illness.
Critically analyse the role of the registered nurse and the interprofessional team in supporting individuals with chronic conditions.

assessments.due_date:
24/03/2026 8:00 am

This online invigilated MCQ quiz will be completed in-class. Please note that you will only be able to access and complete the quiz at this time. Check your timetable to comfirm the day, time and venue. You will need to arrive at the entry to the timetabled room 10 minutes before the scheduled start time.
assessments.task_description:
The MCQ quiz will be accessible through the course Blackboard site. Questions will cover content from the Introduction Module and Module 1 (Topics 1-4), as well as the associated lectures and tutorials from Weeks 1-4. You will have 60 minutes to answer 40 multiple choice questions. Each question is worth 0.5 marks, totalling 20 marks. Students will only have ONE ATTEMPT to complete this quiz.

Please refer to the assessment task sheet, which can be accessed via the course Blackboard site.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The quiz will be accessible through the course Blackboard site and will self-submit after 60 minutes. This is an identity verified assessment, and instructors will check your student ID as you enter the room. Students who arrive late or who do not have their student ID card with them will not be permitted to enter the room and will fail this assessment with zero (0) marks. Students who are not in class and identity verified when they sit this online MCQ quiz will fail this assessment with zero (0) marks.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.due_date:
2/04/2026 1:00 pm

Part A (Oral Viva) presubmission document must be submitted by 1pm on Thursday of Week 6 (2.4.26) prior to oral vivas in Week 7. Part B (Group Presentation) PowerPoint files must be submitted by 1pm on Friday of Week 8 (24.4.26) prior to group presentations which will be delivered and assessed during timetabled Week 9 IBL sessions.
assessments.task_description:
This assessment is completed in two parts: Part A (Oral Viva), followed by Part B (Group Presentation). Together, the two parts of this assessment task examine your ability to locate, evaluate, communicate, and apply high-quality scholarly evidence to the development of a community-based chronic illness management program.

Part A is an individual assessment designed to support your preparation for the group oral presentation (Part B). In Part A (Oral Viva), you will demonstrate your ability to locate and evaluate high-quality evidence appropriate for use in developing a community-based chronic condition management program and explain how this evidence can be used to inform nursing practice.Â 

In Part B, you will work in small groups to develop and deliver a PowerPoint presentation that demonstrates your understanding of the needs of the person with chronic illness as they live in the community, and the role of the registered nurse as a coordinator of care. Students will work as a team to develop a program for people with chronic illness that builds their self-efficacy and ability to self-manage their illness.

The task description and marking rubric for this assessment are available via the "Assessments" tab on the NURS7126 Blackboard site.
assessments.submission_guidelines: Part A: Upload a copy of your presubmission document (Sources of Evidence table) via the submission point on Blackboard by the due date (prior to your viva).
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 10(23 Feb - 10 May)
learning_activities.topic:
Online Learning Modules

You are expected to spend approximately five (5) hours per week on online learning for this course. This includes working through the online modules and recommended and required readings. Your online modules are housed in UQ Extend, and can be accessed via the Course Resources section of the Blackboard site for this course.


Learning outcomes: L01, L02, L03, L04, L05
